policies.attendance: Attendance at weekly live sessions are required.
policies.late_work: Late assignments will be assessed a 5% penalty for EACH 24 hour period that the assignment is late.

important_dates: Final exam covers all content for the entire semester.

additional_info.course_format: This is an in-person course held Thursday 6:30-8pm.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, navigating Canvas, programming experience in an object-oriented language, preferably Java or Python.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

_metadata.course_description: This course examines agile methods, including Extreme Programming (XP), Scrum, Lean, Crystal, Dynamic Systems Development Method and Feature-Driven Development to understand how rapid realization of software occurs most effectively.
learning_outcomes: Compare and contrast several agile methods for software development.
Compare and contrast the origins and motivations of the Agile Manifesto vs. historical methodologies.
Refactor code and tests to meet changing needs.
Measure and monitor velocity of development.
Compare and contrast plan-driven versus agile methods.
prerequisites: Programming experience in an object-oriented language, preferably Java or Python
